definitions.definition: a person or an animal that travels with you or spends a lot of time with you

examples.text: Geoff was my companion on the journey.
Fear was the hostages' constant companion.

definitions.definition: a person who shares your experiences, especially when these are particularly pleasant or unpleasant

examples.text: She was a charming dinner companion.
His younger brother is not much of a companion for him.
They're drinking companions *(= they go out drinking together)*.
He was an entertaining dinner companion.

definitions.definition: a person, usually a woman, employed to live with and help somebody, especially somebody old or ill

examples.text: She lived in the house as a companion to our grandmother.

definitions.definition: one of a pair of things that go together or can be used together

examples.text: A companion volume is soon to be published.

definitions.definition: used in book titles to describe a book giving useful facts and information on a particular subject

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French compaignon, literally ‘one who breaks bread with another’, based on Latin com- ‘together with’ + panis ‘bread’.
